newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Nordic Investment Bank HK$1 bln bond group forms.
newsitem.headline: Nordic Investment Bank HK$1 bln bond group forms.

text.p: A group has formed for Nordic Investment Bank's HK$1.0 billion fixed rate bond due February 12, 2004, lead manager HSBC Markets said on Monday.

The seven-year issue was launched earlier today and priced/re-offered at 100.34. It pays a coupon of 7.37 percent to yield 7.5103 percent, or 39.5 basis points over the 6.80 percent Hong Kong Exchange Fund Notes due November 2003 or 90 basis points over the interpolated U.S. Treasury note.
Application has been made to the Hong Kong Monetary Authority to accept the issue as eligible for its Liquidity Adjustment Facility, or discount window.
HSBC Markets is the lead manager and bookrunner.
Managers are Daiwa Securities (HK), DKB Asia, Jardine Fleming, JP Morgan Securities Asia, Oakreed Financial Service and Tokyo-Mitsubishi International (HK).
The bonds are now free to trade.
